DOC.brief_summary: The study multicenter , randomize , 2-period , open-label , two arm , cross-over study show superior effect 4 week treatment QVA149 versus tiotropium lung function . Similarly , study aim evaluate patient preference experience treatment regimens patient clinical diagnosis COPD ( GOLD 2013 ) moderate severe airflow limitation symptomatic ( defined CAT score least 10 ) screen despite treated tiotropium
DOC.brief_title: Lung Function Patient Preference With QVA149 vs. Tiotropium COPD Patients
DOC.criteria: sign Informed Consent Form stable COPD accord current guideline ( GOLD 2013 ) airflow limitation indicate postbronchodilator FEV1/FVC ratio < 0.70 postbronchodilator FEV1 ≥30 % < 80 % predict normal value Visit 2. current exsmokers smoke history least 10 pack year Patients stable tiotropium ( 18 µg/d ) monotherapy least 8 week Visit 1 Symptomatic patient define patient CAT score ≥ 10 Visit 1 ( Screening ) . Pregnant breast feeding mother Patients condition contraindicate treatment Patients history clinically significant disease Patients clinically significant renal disease Patients myocardial infarction less 6 month prior study entry Patients recent ( less 1 year ) history NYHA Class III/IV leave ventricular failure . Patients narrowangle glaucoma , symptomatic prostatic hyperplasia bladderneck obstruction urinary retention Patients history malignancy organ system Patients COPD exacerbation require treatment antibiotic , and/or systemic steroid ( oral intravenous ) and/or hospitalization 6 week prior Screening Patients respiratory tract infection within 6 week prior Screening Patients history asthma .
